column4: Try to check with "xset m" if you can modify the mouse pointer speed.

Well, you may need to create an xorg.conf file. Pease can you let me know your ThinkPad X model again?
According to my finding it shoudl use the synaptics driver.
I mentioned this because it could have been detected as PS/2 Mouse.
'xinput' shows SynPS/2 Synaptics TouchPad
Excellent. Now we need to figure out if X loads the driver. Can you check with your Xorg.0.log in /var/log? It shoudl tell how the drivers are loaded.
Also, you may need to create an xorg.log (Xorg :1 -configure > ~/xorg.conf.new) as root
yeah it looks like the synaptic driver, x-axis range 1472-5768, y-axis 1408-5062

That means you're almost there. Once you have created the file check if you're not using an xorg.conf already. The file is in /etc/X11. If not you can copy your ~/xorg.conf.new to /etc/X11/xorg.conf. With this nothing will have changed yet. You then need to see if there are parameters to modify the settings. On a side note, can we be sure the driver isn't loaded twice?
should it be in lsmod?
